meanings.definition: To watch or observe an event or activity as a spectator.
meanings.sent1: She spectates the game from the stands.
meanings.sent2: He always spectates the soccer matches on weekends.
meanings.sent3: The cat spectates the birds outside with great interest.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes spectate the unfolding drama with intensity.
meanings.sent5: The child spectates the magic show in awe.

meanings.definition: The act of watching an event or activity as a spectator.
meanings.sent1: His spectates at the theater are always enjoyable.
meanings.sent2: The spectates at the concert were thrilled by the performance.
meanings.sent3: The dog's spectates at the squirrel chase were amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The moon's spectates of the Earth are a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The audience's spectates at the circus were filled with excitement.
